item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://calculatormalaysia.com.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: About Us - Copy
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
About Us

Calculators Malaysia helps Malaysians make smarter financial decisions with simple, accurate, and easy-to-use online calculators.

Whether youre applying for a personal loan, buying a home, planning a car purchase, or comparing insurance options, our tools give you instant clarity no spreadsheets or complex formulas required.

Our Mission

To empower every Malaysian to understand their money, credit, and affordability better so you can plan confidently, borrow wisely, and reach your goals faster.

We believe financial tools should be:

  • Fast Instant results, no waiting or sign-ups.

  • Transparent Clear explanations of how numbers are calculated.

  • Practical Tailored for Malaysias real bank rates, taxes, and regulations.

What We Offer

We currently feature a growing range of financial and lifestyle calculators, including:

  • Personal Loan Calculator Malaysia Estimate loan amount, interest, and eligibility based on salary.

  • Home Loan & Mortgage Calculators Check monthly instalments, DSR ratio, and affordability.

  • Car Loan & Insurance Calculators Compare repayment terms and yearly insurance cost.

  • Education & CGPA Calculators Track academic performance easily.

  • Savings, Tax, and EPF Calculators Plan better for long-term goals.

Each calculator uses the latest Malaysia-specific financial data (e.g. interest rate ranges, DSR guidelines, and EPF contributions) to provide realistic results that reflect local conditions.

Why Malaysians Trust Us

  • 100% free to use no hidden fees or registration.

  • Designed with Malaysian financial institutions in mind.

  • Updated regularly for accuracy.

  • Built for both desktop and mobile use.

We continuously expand our library to include new financial tools from loan eligibility to investment planning making Calculators Malaysia your one-stop resource for smarter money management.

Get in Touch

Have a calculator idea or found an error?
Wed love to hear from you.

Email: admin@calculatormalaysia.com

Free Online Calculator Malaysia

Loan Calculator Malaysia

Insurance Calculator Malaysia

Credit Card Calculator Malaysia

Tax Calculator Malaysia

Property Calculator Malaysia

CGPA Calculator Malaysia

Welcome to Calculator Malaysia, your all-in-one hub for the most useful online calculators in Malaysia. Whether youre planning your next property purchase, checking car or motorcycle insurance, calculating your monthly salary after EPF & SOCSO, or working out your CGPA, weve got you covered.

Our calculators are designed for Malaysians fast, accurate, and easy to use on both desktop and mobile.

Explore our categories:

  • Insurance Calculators Car, Motorcycle, EV, Allianz, Cheapest Premiums

  • Property Calculators Quit Rent Selangor, Housing Loan, Stamp Duty

  • Salary & Tax Calculators PCB, EPF, SOCSO, Income Tax 2025

  • Education Calculators CGPA & Grade Calculators for IIUM, UHTM, and more

No more guesswork get instant results tailored to Malaysian rules and rates.

FAQ Section

What is Calculator Malaysia?
Calculator Malaysia is a free platform offering online calculators for Malaysians, including property, insurance, salary, tax, and education tools.

Why use Calculator Malaysia instead of bank calculators?
Unlike single-purpose bank calculators, our site gathers all essential calculators in one place, making it easier to compare and plan your finances.

Is Calculator Malaysia free?
Yes! All calculators are free to use and optimized for Malaysian needs.

What calculators are most popular in Malaysia?
The most searched calculators include car loan calculators, salary/EPF calculators, property loan calculators, and motorcycle insurance calculators.

Can I use these calculators on mobile?
Yes every calculator on Calculator Malaysia is mobile-friendly, so you can calculate on the go.

item.title: Quit Rent Calculator Selangor
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Quit Rent Calculator Selangor [y]

Kalkulator Cukai Tanah Selangor

Loading...

What is Quit Rent (Cukai Tanah) in Selangor?

Quit rent (cukai tanah) is an annual land tax required for all property owners in Selangor. The amount depends on your land size, property type, and district. Use this calculator to get your 2025 quit rent amount instantly.

How to Use:

  1. Enter property size (sq ft/sq m)
  2. Select property type and district
  3. Click Calculate for your 2025 quit rent

Current Selangor Quit Rent Rates:

  • Residential: RM0.35/sq m, min RM15
  • Commercial: RM0.50/sq m, min RM40
    Rates subject to change by Selangor Land Office

FAQ

Who must pay?

All landowners in Selangor.

When to pay?

  • By May 31 each year.

How to pay?

Online via Land Office/JomPAY/counter.

Penalties?

Yes, late payments incur fines.
item.excerpt:encoded: Instantly calculate your Selangor quit rent (cukai tanah) for 2025. Easy-to-use online calculator for residential and commercial property owners in Selangor. 100% free and updated.

item.title: UHTM Grade Calculator
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
UTHM Grade Calculator [y]

Loading...

UTHM GPA & CGPA Calculator Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia

Easily calculate your GPA (Grade Point Average) and CGPA (Cumulative Grade Point Average) for Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia (UTHM) using our fast, mobile-friendly calculator.
Whether youre checking your semester results or planning your target CGPA, this tool helps you get accurate results instantly.

What is GPA & CGPA in UTHM?

GPA (PNG) Purata Nilai Gred for a single semester.
CGPA (PNGK) Purata Nilai Gred Kumulatif across all semesters.

UTHM uses a 4.00 grading scale. Each grade is assigned a point value, which is multiplied by the course credit hours, then divided by total credits.

What is GPA & CGPA in UTHM?

Marks (%)GradeGrade Point Value
85 100A4.00
80 84A-3.67
75 79B+3.33
70 74B3.00
65 69B-2.67
60 64C+2.33
55 59C2.00
50 54C-1.67
45 49D+1.33
40 44D1.00
0 39F0.00

How to Use This Calculator

  • Enter your previous total credits and CGPA (optional for CGPA calculation).

  • Add each subject for the current semester:

    • Course name (optional)

    • Grade (A, A-, B+, etc.)

    • Credit hours

  • See your current GPA and updated CGPA instantly.

  • Use the Target CGPA feature to plan your grades for upcoming semesters.

  • Export results as PDF/PNG for your records.

Benefits of Using This UTHM CGPA Calculator

Real-time calculation No need to press "calculate" each time.

Accurate grading scale Matches official UTHM academic regulations.

Mobile-friendly Works perfectly on smartphones & tablets.

Target CGPA planner Set academic goals and track your progress.

Save your data Calculator remembers your inputs for your next visit.

FAQ UTHM CGPA Calculator

1. Adakah kalkulator ini rasmi daripada UTHM?

Tidak. Kalkulator ini adalah alat bantuan pelajar berdasarkan jadual gred rasmi UTHM.

2. Bolehkah saya ubah skala gred?

  • Ya, anda boleh pilih gred sendiri mengikut keputusan anda.

3. Bagaimana PNGK dikira?

CGPA = (Jumlah Nilai Gred Kumulatif) (Jumlah Kredit Kumulatif)

4. Adakah gred C- atau D dikira dalam PNGK?

Ya, semua gred termasuk D dikira dalam PNGK kecuali kursus lulus/gagal tanpa nilai gred.
item.excerpt:encoded: Calculate GPA & CGPA for Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia (UTHM) instantly. Includes official UTHM grading table, real-time GPA calculator, and target CGPA planner. Fast, accurate, and mobile-friendly.

item.title: CGPA Calculator UIA
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
CGPA Calculator UIA [y]

IIUM CGPA Calculator (International Islamic University Malaysia)

Loading...

IIUM Grading System [y]

Marks (%) Letter Grade Grade Point
80 100 A 4.00
75 79 A 3.67
70 74 B+ 3.33
65 69 B 3.00
60 64 B 2.67
55 59 C+ 2.33
50 54 C 2.00
45 49 D 1.67
40 44 D 1.33
35 39 E 1.00
0 34 F 0.00

Kalkulator CGPA IIUM (UIA)

Kalkulator CGPA IIUM membantu pelajar Universiti Islam Antarabangsa Malaysia (UIA) mengira GPA (Purata Nilai Gred) dan CGPA (Purata Nilai Gred Kumulatif) dengan cepat dan tepat. Dengan alat ini, anda hanya perlu masukkan gred kursus dan jam kredit untuk mengetahui kedudukan akademik anda secara serta-merta.

Sistem Gred IIUM

Sistem gred IIUM menggunakan skala 4.00 di mana setiap gred huruf mempunyai nilai gred tertentu. Contohnya, A bersamaan dengan 4.00, A- bernilai 3.67, B+ bernilai 3.33, dan seterusnya sehingga F yang bernilai 0.00. Skala gred ini digunakan dalam program ijazah sarjana muda untuk memastikan penilaian yang adil dan konsisten.

Cara Kira CGPA di IIUM

Untuk mengira CGPA di IIUM, darabkan nilai gred dengan jam kredit bagi setiap kursus untuk mendapatkan mata berkualiti. Jumlahkan semua mata berkualiti dan bahagi dengan jumlah keseluruhan jam kredit yang diambil. Kalkulator CGPA ini memudahkan proses tersebut dengan memberikan keputusan secara automatik dan masa nyata.

Kedudukan Kelas CGPA IIUM

Berdasarkan CGPA, IIUM mengklasifikasikan prestasi pelajar kepada beberapa kategori seperti Ijazah Kepujian Kelas Pertama, Kelas Kedua Atas, Kelas Kedua Bawah, atau Lulus. Sebagai contoh, CGPA 3.67 ke atas biasanya melayakkan pelajar ke Kelas Pertama. Dengan menggunakan kalkulator ini, anda boleh memantau kategori kedudukan akademik anda dan merancang pembelajaran dengan lebih baik.

Kelebihan Guna Kalkulator CGPA IIUM

Menggunakan kalkulator dalam talian menjimatkan masa dan mengurangkan kesilapan dalam pengiraan GPA atau CGPA. Ia amat berguna untuk merancang sasaran CGPA, memantau prestasi sepanjang semester, dan bersedia untuk memenuhi syarat akademik seperti biasiswa atau anugerah ijazah kelas pertama.

Soalan Lazim Kalkulator CGPA IIUM

1. Adakah kalkulator ini rasmi daripada IIUM?

Tidak. Kalkulator ini bukan rasmi daripada IIUM, tetapi ia dibina berdasarkan sistem gred rasmi universiti untuk membantu pelajar membuat pengiraan GPA dan CGPA dengan lebih mudah.

2. Bagaimana cara kira CGPA di UIA?

CGPA dikira dengan mendarab nilai gred dengan jam kredit setiap kursus untuk dapatkan mata berkualiti. Jumlahkan semua mata berkualiti dan bahagi dengan jumlah keseluruhan jam kredit. Kalkulator ini akan membuat pengiraan secara automatik.

3. Apakah sistem gred yang digunakan di IIUM?

IIUM menggunakan skala 4.00. Contohnya, A = 4.00, A- = 3.67, B+ = 3.33, B = 3.00, C = 2.00, D = 1.33, dan F = 0.00.

4. Apakah maksud Kelas Pertama, Kelas Kedua Atas dan Kelas Kedua Bawah?

IIUM mengklasifikasikan kedudukan akademik pelajar berdasarkan CGPA. CGPA 3.67 ke atas biasanya Kelas Pertama, manakala julat CGPA lain menentukan Kelas Kedua Atas, Kelas Kedua Bawah atau Lulus.

5. Bolehkah kalkulator ini digunakan untuk sasaran CGPA?

Ya. Anda boleh masukkan CGPA sasaran dan jumlah baki jam kredit untuk melihat gred purata yang diperlukan bagi mencapai sasaran tersebut.
item.excerpt:encoded: Kalkulator CGPA IIUM (UIA) untuk kira GPA & CGPA dengan mudah. Termasuk sistem gred rasmi, cara kira CGPA, dan kedudukan kelas akademik.

item.title: Kalkulator Insurans Motor Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Kalkulator Insurans Motor Malaysia ([y])

Loading...

Nak kira premium insurans motor anda dengan cepat? Gunakan kalkulator insurans motor kami untuk dapatkan anggaran harga insurans motor berdasarkan kapasiti enjin (cc), jenis perlindungan, NCD, dan umur motor. Mudah, pantas, dan percuma sesuai untuk semua penunggang motor di Malaysia.

Apa Itu Kalkulator Insurans Motor?

Kalkulator insurans motor membantu anda mengira jumlah premium insurans sebelum anda memperbaharui atau membeli polisi baru. Dengan hanya beberapa klik, anda boleh tahu berapa kos perlindungan Third Party atau Comprehensive, termasuk diskaun NCD dan duti setem.

Cara Guna Kalkulator Insurans Motor Online

  1. Pilih Jenis Perlindungan Third Party atau Comprehensive.

  2. Masukkan Nilai Diinsuranskan (Sum Insured).

  3. Pilih Kapasiti Enjin (cc) motor anda.

  4. Masukkan Diskaun Tanpa Tuntutan (NCD) anda.

  5. (Opsyenal) Tambah Cukai Jalan untuk kiraan penuh.

  6. Klik Kira terus dapat jumlah premium anggaran anda.

Faktor Yang Mempengaruhi Harga Insurans Motor di Malaysia

  • Kapasiti Enjin (CC): Lagi besar enjin, lagi tinggi premium.

  • Jenis Perlindungan: Comprehensive lebih mahal berbanding Third Party.

  • NCD (No Claim Discount): Lagi lama anda tak buat tuntutan, lagi murah harga.

  • Umur Motorsikal: Motor baru biasanya lebih tinggi premium.

  • Sejarah Kemalangan: Pernah buat tuntutan? Premium mungkin naik.

Bandingkan Syarikat Insurans Motor Popular

Antara syarikat insurans motor yang terkenal di Malaysia:

  • Allianz

  • Zurich

  • Etiqa

  • Takaful Ikhlas

  • Berjaya Sompo

  • MyEG

Dengan kalkulator ini, anda boleh bandingkan kos perlindungan sebelum pilih syarikat insurans terbaik untuk bajet anda.

Kenapa Penting Kira Insurans Motor Awal?

Elak kejutan kos semasa renew roadtax & insurans.
Boleh rancang bajet bulanan / tahunan lebih baik.
Pilih insurans yang sesuai dengan keperluan & motor anda.
Jangka penjimatan premium melalui NCD dalam 35 tahun.

Kalkulator Cukai Jalan & Insurans Motor

Ramai penunggang motor cari cara untuk kira cukai jalan + insurans sekali gus. Dengan fungsi tambahan ini, anda boleh tahu jumlah keseluruhan yang perlu dibayar masa renew.

Soalan Lazim (FAQ) Insurans Motorsikal di Malaysia

Insurans motorsikal mana yang paling murah di Malaysia?

Insurans paling murah biasanya adalah perlindungan Third Party, kerana ia hanya melindungi kerosakan atau kecederaan yang anda sebabkan kepada pihak lain. Perlindungan Comprehensive lebih mahal tetapi memberikan perlindungan lebih luas termasuk motorsikal anda sendiri. Premium juga bergantung pada kapasiti enjin (cc), umur motor, dan Diskaun Tanpa Tuntutan (NCD).

Adakah insurans motor wajib di Malaysia?

Ya. Di bawah undang-undang Malaysia, semua kenderaan termasuk motorsikal mesti mempunyai sekurang-kurangnya insurans Third Party sebelum anda boleh memperbaharui cukai jalan. Menunggang tanpa insurans yang sah adalah salah di sisi undang-undang dan boleh dikenakan penalti.

Syarikat insurans mana yang paling murah di Malaysia?

Tiada satu syarikat yang sentiasa paling murah untuk semua orang, kerana premium bergantung pada jenis motorsikal dan profil penunggang. Antara syarikat insurans popular di Malaysia ialah Allianz, Etiqa, Zurich, Takaful Ikhlas, Berjaya Sompo, dan MyEG. Sebaiknya bandingkan sebut harga sebelum membuat pilihan.

Insurans motor mana yang terbaik di Malaysia?

Insurans terbaik bergantung pada keperluan anda. Jika anda mahu kos paling rendah, Third Party adalah pilihan terbaik. Jika anda mahu perlindungan penuh termasuk motor anda sendiri, pilih Comprehensive. Sesetengah penunggang juga lebih suka syarikat yang menawarkan proses tuntutan cepat dan khidmat pelanggan yang baik.

Berapa banyak NCD saya dapat setiap tahun?

Untuk motorsikal di Malaysia, NCD akan meningkat setiap tahun anda menunggang tanpa membuat tuntutan, sehingga maksimum 25% selepas lima tahun. Contoh:

  • Tahun 1: 0%

  • Tahun 2: 15%

  • Tahun 35: 25% (maksimum)

Bolehkah saya pindahkan NCD ke motorsikal lain?

Ya, anda boleh pindahkan NCD apabila membeli motorsikal baru, tetapi ia mesti didaftarkan atas nama yang sama. NCD tidak boleh dikongsi antara dua motorsikal aktif pada masa yang sama.

Bolehkah saya pindahkan NCD kepada isteri atau ahli keluarga?

Tidak, NCD tidak boleh dipindahkan kepada orang lain walaupun ahli keluarga. Ia hanya terikat pada nama pemegang polisi, bukan kenderaan.

Bagaimana saya boleh semak NCD saya di Malaysia?

Anda boleh semak status NCD semasa melalui syarikat insurans anda, MyEG, atau pangkalan data NCD PIAM (Persatuan Insurans Am Malaysia). Sesetengah syarikat insurans juga menyediakan alat semakan NCD secara online.

Perlindungan insurans motorsikal mana yang terbaik?

Perlindungan Comprehensive adalah yang terbaik kerana ia melindungi motorsikal anda daripada kecurian, kebakaran, kemalangan, serta liabiliti pihak ketiga. Ia amat disyorkan untuk motorsikal baru atau bernilai tinggi seperti superbike.

Bagaimana cara dapatkan insurans motorsikal lebih murah di Malaysia?

  • Kekalkan rekod tunggangan bersih untuk mengekalkan NCD.

  • Pilih pelan perlindungan lebih rendah (Third Party jika bajet terhad).

  • Bandingkan sebut harga dari beberapa syarikat insurans.

  • Elakkan tambahan (add-ons) yang tidak diperlukan.

Disclaimer: Kalkulator ini hanya anggaran. Sila rujuk syarikat insurans untuk jumlah sebenar.

item.title: Motorcycle Road Tax and Insurance Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Motorcycle Road tax and Insurance Calculator Malaysia [y]

Loading... Click here

Want to know your full yearly cost of owning a motorcycle? Our calculator helps you estimate both motorcycle insurance and road tax together in one simple step. Just enter your bikes engine capacity, coverage type, NCD, and optional add-ons and youll instantly see your total cost.

What is a Motorcycle Insurance Calculator?

A motorcycle insurance calculator helps you calculate the estimated insurance premium before renewing or buying a new policy. With just a few inputs, you can see the cost of Third Party or Comprehensive coverage, including NCD discounts and stamp duty.

MYEG vs Bjak Which One Should You Choose?

MYEG (Trust & Reliability)

  • Trusted by millions of Malaysians for road tax & JPJ services.

  • Seamless integration with government systems.

  • Peace of mind with a well-established provider.

Bjak (Price & Speed)

  • Compare multiple insurers instantly.

  • Often offers discounts, promos, and cashback.

  • Quick and simple renewal process online.

Tip:

If you prefer trusted reliability, go with MYEG.
If you want to find the best deal & save instantly, try Bjak.

How to Use the Motorcycle Insurance Calculator Online

  1. Select your Coverage Type Third Party or Comprehensive.

  2. Enter the Sum Insured (RM).

  3. Choose your Engine Capacity (cc).

  4. Select your No-Claim Discount (NCD).

  5. (Optional) Add Road Tax for a full calculation.

  6. Click Calculate and see your estimated premium instantly.

Factors That Affect Motorcycle Insurance Premiums in Malaysia

  • Engine Capacity (CC): The larger the engine, the higher the premium.

  • Coverage Type: Comprehensive is more expensive than Third Party.

  • NCD (No Claim Discount): The longer you go without claims, the cheaper your premium.

  • Motorcycle Age: Newer motorcycles usually cost more to insure.

  • Accident History: If youve made claims before, your premium may increase.

Compare Popular Motorcycle Insurance Companies

Some of the top motorcycle insurance providers in Malaysia include:

  • Allianz

  • Zurich

  • Etiqa

  • Takaful Ikhlas

  • Berjaya Sompo

  • MyEG

With our calculator, you can compare protection costs before choosing the best insurer for your budget.

Why Calculate Motorcycle Insurance Early?

Avoid surprise costs when renewing road tax & insurance.
Plan your monthly or yearly budget better.
Choose the right insurance type for your motorcycle.
See long-term savings through NCD growth over 35 years.

Road Tax + Motorcycle Insurance Calculator

Many riders in Malaysia want to calculate both road tax and insurance together. With our added function, you can see the total amount youll need to pay when renewing your motorcycle documents.

Which motorcycle insurance is the cheapest in Malaysia?

The cheapest motorcycle insurance is usually Third Party coverage, as it only protects against damage or injury you cause to others. Comprehensive coverage costs more but includes your own motorcycle. Premiums also depend on your bikes CC, age, and your No Claim Discount (NCD).

Is motor insurance compulsory in Malaysia?

Yes. Under Malaysian law, all vehicles including motorcycles must have at least Third Party insurance before you can renew your road tax. Riding without insurance is illegal and can lead to penalties.

Which insurance company is the cheapest in Malaysia?

There isnt a single cheapest company for everyone, since premiums vary by bike type and rider profile. Popular insurers include Allianz, Zurich, Etiqa, Takaful Ikhlas, Berjaya Sompo, and MyEG. Always compare quotes before making a decision.

Which motor insurance is best in Malaysia?

The best insurance depends on your needs. If you want the lowest cost, Third Party is best. For peace of mind and full protection, Comprehensive is better. Some riders prefer insurers with fast claims and strong customer service.

How much NCD do I get per year?

For motorcycles in Malaysia, the NCD increases every year you ride claim-free, up to a maximum of 25% after 5 years:

  • Year 1: 0%

  • Year 2: 15%

  • Year 35: 25% (maximum)

Can I transfer my NCD to another motorcycle?

Yes, you can transfer your NCD when you buy a new motorcycle, but it must remain under the same name. You cant share NCD across two active motorcycles.

Can I transfer my NCD to my wife or family member?

No. NCD cannot be transferred to another person, even a spouse. It belongs to the policyholder, not the vehicle.

How do I check my NCD in Malaysia?

You can check your current NCD with your insurer, via MyEG, or through the PIAM (Persatuan Insurans Am Malaysia) NCD database. Some insurers also provide an NCD checker online.

Which motorcycle insurance coverage is the best?

Comprehensive coverage is the best for full protection, as it covers your motorcycle against theft, fire, accidents, and third-party liability. Highly recommended for new or high-value bikes.

How do I get cheaper motorcycle insurance in Malaysia?

  • Keep a clean riding record to maintain your NCD.

  • Choose a lower coverage plan (Third Party if budget is tight).

  • Compare quotes from multiple insurers.

  • Skip unnecessary add-ons if you dont need them.

Why Combine Road Tax and Insurance?

Most riders in Malaysia need to renew both insurance and road tax at the same time. By using our calculator, you dont need two separate tools youll know:

  • Insurance Premium (Third Party or Comprehensive)

  • Stamp Duty (RM10)

  • Road Tax based on engine CC

  • Total Amount (Insurance + Road Tax)

Motorcycle Road Tax in Malaysia (Quick Reference)

Motorcycle road tax is generally affordable, but it increases with engine capacity:

  • Up to 150cc: RM2 RM30

  • 151cc 250cc: RM50 RM100

  • 251cc 500cc: RM150 RM250

  • 501cc 800cc: RM300 RM400

  • Above 800cc: RM500+

With our calculator, these amounts are automatically added into your total.

Example Calculation

For a 150cc motorcycle insured at RM5,000 with Comprehensive coverage and no NCD:

  • Basic Premium: RM550

  • Stamp Duty: RM10

  • Road Tax: RM30

  • Total Yearly Cost = RM590

Benefits of Using the Combined Calculator

Save time no need for separate insurance and road tax calculators
Plan your budget more accurately
Compare Third Party vs Comprehensive cost with road tax included
See your long-term savings when your NCD increases

FAQ Road Tax and Insurance in Malaysia

Do I need insurance before I can renew road tax?

Yes. In Malaysia, you must have valid motorcycle insurance before renewing road tax.

Why is road tax different in East Malaysia?

Road tax in Sabah and Sarawak is generally cheaper compared to Peninsular Malaysia.

Can I calculate car road tax here too?

This tool is focused on motorcycles. For cars, road tax is higher and depends on whether its a saloon (sedan/hatchback) or non-saloon (SUV, MPV, pickup).

Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates only. Please check with your insurance company for the exact premium amount.

Cheapest Motorcycle Insurance Calculator Malaysia [y]

Loading...

Are you looking for the cheapest motorcycle insurance in Malaysia? With premiums climbing and riders constantly seeking affordable options, our combined Road Tax & Motorcycle Insurance Calculator gives you the clarity you needfast.

Why the Focus on Cheapest?

In Malaysia, many ridersespecially those using kapcai and scooterssearch for low-cost insurance options. Third Party coverage remains the most affordable choice, with premiums starting from about RM30 for bikes under 150cc OtoFacts+6Fincrew+6Berjaya Sompo+6. However, actual costs vary based on bike age, CC, NCD, and add-ons.

Using our tool, you get a precise estimatemaking it easier to identify the cheapest option for your bike.

What Affects Your Premium?

Several factors determine how affordable your motorcycle insurance will be:

  1. Coverage Type
    Third Party is cheapest; Comprehensive adds protection for your bike and costs more Kurnia+1.

  2. Engine Capacity (CC)
    Bikes with larger engines (e.g., 250cc+) carry higher premiums. Smaller bikes (150cc) are significantly cheaper wwwallianzcommy+5Qoala+5Fincrew+5.

  3. NCD (No-Claim Discount)
    Riding claim-free can save up to 25% over time.

  4. Bike Age & Market Value
    Older or lower-value bikes usually have lower premiums BJAK+8Qoala+8Fincrew+8Berjaya Sompo.

  5. Add-ons & Riders Covered
    Including extras like Personal Accident (PA), flood, or All Riders increases cost but adds protection wwwallianzcommy+6BJAK+6Berjaya Sompo+6.

  6. Location
    Insurance in Peninsular Malaysia may cost more due to higher traffic and accident rates compared to East Malaysia Qoala+1.

How Our Calculator Helps You Find the Cheapest Option

Our smart calculator lets you:

  • Switch between coverage types (Third Party vs Comprehensive) to see cost difference quickly.

  • Compare insurance costs and road tax in one goso you know your total yearly expense.

  • Adjust NCD levels to model savings over the years.

  • See the impact of add-ons, helping you prioritize whats essential vs optional.

Within seconds, you get a breakdown: Basic Premium, Stamp Duty, Road Tax, and your Total Costempowering smarter decisions.

Example: Cheapest vs Comprehensive

For a quick illustration:

  • Motorcycle: 150cc

  • Sum Insured: RM5,000

  • NCD: 15%

Third-Party Estimate: RM260 (low-cost protection only)
Comprehensive Estimate: RM590 (wider coverage plus optional add-ons)

Our calculator helps riders easily see that Third Party is the cheapestand ideal for budget-conscious users.

Tips to Lower Your Insurance Premium

  • Choose Third Party coverage if you want the most affordable option.

  • Keep your NCD as high as possibleeven small percentages make a difference.

  • Limit expensive add-ons unless necessary.

  • Compare across insurerseven the cheapest provider today may not remain so tomorrow.

Riders Real Experiences

On social forums like Reddit, many report paying only about RM46 for Third Party insurance after stripping down markups or extra mandatory fees. Still, being vigilant helps ensure youre not overcharged inadvertently itchyboots.com+15Reddit+15Fincrew+15Fincrew+2Fincrew+2wwwallianzcommy+5Berjaya Sompo+5BJAK+5.

Why You Dont Need Multiple Calculators

Surprisingly, you dont need separate tools for cheapest or Allianz searches. Our single, powerful calculator handles everythingfrom cost comparisons to brand-specific pricing contexts. Just adjust your inputs, select Third Party, compare, and find the lowest cost optionall in one place.

Use Our Calculator to Find the Cheapest Motorcycle Insurance in Malaysia

Tired of jumping between sites? Use our Motorcycle Road Tax & Insurance Calculator Malaysia to:

  • Instantly find the cheapest insurance option for your bike

  • Factor in road tax, stamp duty, and see your total yearly cost

  • Watch your NCD savings grow over time

Save time, see clearer pricing, and choose the most affordable optionwith confidence.

item.title: EV Car Insurance Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
EV Car Insurance Calculator Malaysia [y]: Estimate Your Premiums & Road Tax Easily

Loading...

Electric vehicles (EVs) are becoming more popular in Malaysia, with models such as the Tesla Model 3, BYD Atto 3, BYD Dolphin, Ora Good Cat, Proton e.MAS 7, and BMW iX now seen on our roads. While owning an EV helps reduce fuel costs and supports a greener future, many Malaysians are unsure about how much insurance and road tax will cost for an electric car.

To make this easier, we created the EV Car Insurance & Road Tax Calculator Malaysia a free tool that lets you estimate both your annual insurance premium and road tax in just a few clicks.

Why Do EV Owners Need a Calculator?

EV insurance in Malaysia can sometimes be more expensive compared to petrol cars because:

  • EVs usually have higher market values.

  • Repairs and spare parts (especially batteries) can cost more.

  • Specialized coverage such as battery protection or home charger coverage may be added.

At the same time, EV road tax is calculated differently. Instead of engine capacity (cc), EVs are taxed based on power output (kW). Many owners are not familiar with these JPJ road tax tiers, which makes it difficult to budget yearly ownership costs.

Our calculator combines both into a single tool so you instantly know the total cost of owning an EV in Malaysia.

How the EV Car Insurance Calculator Works

The calculator is designed for Malaysian drivers and is very simple to use.

You only need to enter:

  1. Vehicle model (e.g. Tesla, BYD, Proton, BMW, Hyundai).

  2. Market value (RM) auto-filled based on average prices but you can edit.

  3. Power output (kW) auto-filled per model, editable if needed.

  4. No Claims Discount (NCD) from 0% to 55%.

  5. Coverage options battery, home charger, special perils, roadside, agreed value.

  6. Region Peninsular Malaysia, Sabah, or Sarawak.

After that, the calculator shows:

  • Estimated Insurance Premium (with breakdown of base, NCD discount, add-ons).

  • Estimated Road Tax (calculated using JPJs official EV formula).

Example: BYD Atto 3 Insurance & Road Tax

Lets say you own a BYD Atto 3 valued at RM150,000 with 150 kW power output.

  • Insurance Premium: ~RM4,125 before discounts (with full add-ons).

  • Road Tax: ~RM602 annually.

If you have maximum 55% NCD, your premium can drop significantly.

EV Insurance Costs in Malaysia (2025 Update)

Based on market data, here are some common ranges for popular EVs:

  • Tesla Model 3 RM4,000 RM4,500/year

  • BYD Dolphin RM2,800 RM3,500/year

  • Proton e.MAS 7 RM2,700 RM3,200/year

  • BMW iX RM7,000+ per year (due to higher market value)

These are estimates only. Actual premiums may differ depending on insurer (Allianz EV Shield, Etiqa EV Plus, Liberty InsureMyTesla, BMW EV Shield, etc.), NCD, and coverage selected.

JPJ EV Road Tax in Malaysia

EV road tax is based on kilowatt (kW) output. For example:

  • 080 kW RM0.40 per kW

  • 126150 kW RM552 + RM2.00 per kW above 125

  • Above 200 kW RM2,802 + RM10.00 per kW above 200

Thats why a Tesla Model 3 (239 kW) has much higher road tax compared to an Ora Good Cat (105 kW).

Benefits of Using Our Calculator

Fast & Easy get your EV insurance + road tax estimate in seconds.
Accurate Formula based on JPJs official road tax tiers and Malaysia insurance rates.
Covers Popular EVs Tesla, BYD, Proton, BMW, Hyundai, MG, Ora, Zeekr, Denza, Xpeng.
Breakdown Included see base premium, NCD discount, add-ons, and total.
Free to Use no signup required.

Plan Your EV Ownership Better

Owning an electric vehicle in Malaysia is rewarding, but its important to budget correctly for insurance and road tax. With our calculator, you can:

  • Compare different EV models before buying.

  • Decide if add-ons like battery coverage or charger protection are worth it.

  • Estimate your total yearly cost at a glance.

item.title: House Loan Calculator Malaysia Based on Salary
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
House Loan Calculator Malaysia Based on Salary

Loading...

Looking to buy a home in Malaysia but not sure how much you can borrow? A house loan calculator Malaysia based on salary helps you quickly estimate your loan eligibility and monthly instalments. By entering your income, existing commitments, and preferred loan tenure, you can know exactly what property price range is affordable for you.

Why Use a House Loan Calculator?

Banks in Malaysia usually allow borrowers to use up to 3040% of their monthly income for housing loans. This percentage is known as the Debt Service Ratio (DSR). A calculator takes into account:

  • Monthly salary (basic + fixed allowances)

  • Current debts (car loan, PTPTN, credit card, personal loan, etc.)

  • Interest rate offered by banks

  • Loan tenure (usually up to 35 years, or age 70)

By combining these factors, the calculator shows the maximum property price and loan amount you can qualify for.

How It Works Example

  • Monthly salary: RM6,000

  • Existing commitments: RM1,000

  • Loan tenure: 30 years

  • Interest rate: 4%

Maximum monthly instalment allowed (based on 35% DSR) = RM2,100
Eligible loan amount RM450,000
Affordable property price RM500,000 (assuming 10% down payment)

Benefits of Using a Salary-Based Loan Calculator

Saves time No need to manually calculate DSR
Realistic property search Focus on homes within budget
Compare banks See how interest rates affect instalments
Plan ahead Avoid rejection when applying for a housing loan

Key Tips Before Applying for a Housing Loan in Malaysia

  • Keep your CCRIS & CTOS score clean (avoid late payments)

  • Reduce other debts to improve your DSR

  • Save at least 10% down payment (plus legal fees & stamp duty)

  • Compare different banks packages before deciding

Final Thoughts

A house loan calculator Malaysia based on salary is the easiest way to know how much home you can afford. Try it before visiting property showrooms so youll have a clear budget in mind.

If youre ready to calculate now, use our free house loan calculator below and find out your maximum loan eligibility instantly.

Whats the Down Payment Like in Malaysia?

  • For most properties, first time homebuyers need to pay at least 10% of the purchase price as down payment. Maybank2u+3PropertyGuru+3PropertyGuru+3

  • For subsequent property purchases, down payments are often higher (20-30%), depending on type of property, location, and applicants credit/ income profile. Hartamas Real Estate

  • There are schemes like Skim Rumah Pertamaku (MyFirst Home Scheme) which help eligible buyers, sometimes allowing more favourable financing or lower down payments under certain price thresholds. Chester Website+1

Debt Service Ratio (DSR) Explained

  • What is DSR? Its how much of your income goes to servicing debts (existing debts + your prospective home loan instalment) as a percentage of your net income. Findoctor+1

  • Typical acceptable DSR range: Banks usually like the DSR to remain at somewhere between 30-40% of your net income. If your total monthly commitments push your DSR too high, you may be rejected or offered less. Sharlife+2Hong Leong Bank+2

  • Some banks might allow up to ~70% DSR in certain circumstances, but thats unusual and depends heavily on the credit history, income stability, etc. Sharlife

Interest Rates & Loan Tenure

  • Interest / profit rates on home loans in Malaysia vary. Many current home financing / profit rates start from ~4-5% p.a., depending on bank, scheme (conventional or Islamic), and buyers profile. RinggitPlus+2CIMB Malaysia+2

  • Loan tenure: usually up to 35 years, or until the borrower reaches age 70, whichever comes first. PropertyGuru+2Hong Leong Bank+2

Other Up-Front Costs to Prepare

Even if you can pay the down payment and loan instalments, there are other costs you need to budget for:

  • Earnest deposit / booking fee: often ~ 2-3% of purchase price. Chester Website+1

  • Legal fees (conveyancing), stamp duty (for Sale & Purchase Agreement, Loan Agreement etc.), valuation fees. Maybank2u+1

  • Sometimes home insurance, property insurance or takaful if Islamic financing.

Sample Scenarios Based on Salary

Here are more examples to show how much home loan someone might qualify for, based on different salary levels, using assumptions common in Malaysia (DSR limit ~ 35-40%, 10% down payment, interest ~4.5%, 30-35 year tenure):

Monthly SalaryExisting monthly debtsMax affordable monthly instalment ( 35% of net)Approx Loan Amount*Approx Property Price*
RM3,000RM500~ RM875~ RM 180,000~ RM 200,000
RM5,000RM1,000~ RM1,400~ RM 300,000~ RM 333,000
RM8,000RM1,500~ RM2,400~ RM 520,000~ RM 580,000
RM12,000RM2,000~ RM3,500~ RM 770,000~ RM 855,000

*These are estimates: actual loan amount depends on bank rate, credit score, down payment, whether youre buying new or subsale property, etc.

Documents & Eligibility Requirements

To apply for a home loan, typically you will need:

  • NRIC / identification

  • Proof of income: salary slips, EPF statement, employer letter

  • Bank statements

  • Details of existing commitments (loan, credit card, etc.)

  • Property details, sales & purchase agreement (if already chosen)

  • Sometimes a credit report (CCRIS / CTOS)

Eligibility conditions often include:

  • Minimum gross monthly income (some banks require RM5,000+ for certain loan types) OCBC Bank Malaysia

  • Age limits: borrower must be at least 18; loan must be repaid by certain age (usually 70) Hong Leong Bank+1

  • Good credit / debt history

Tips to Improve Your Chances of Approval

  • Lower your existing debts to reduce DSR

  • Increase your gross/net income if possible (overtime, bonuses, second job etc.)

  • Save for a bigger down payment so loan amount is smaller

  • Keep good credit history (no late payments)

  • Compare offers from several banks / financial institutions

FAQs to Keep

  • How much loan can I get if my salary is RM5,000 per month? (Use the sample scenario or allow users to plug numbers)

  • What happens if I pay more than 10% down payment? (Reduces monthly repayment & total interest)

  • Can I use EPF Account II funds for down payment? Yes, under certain conditions. Chester Website+1

  • What are the differences between conventional and Islamic home financing?

item.title: Home Loan Eligibility Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Home Loan Eligibility Calculator Malaysia

Loading...

Buying a home is one of the biggest financial decisions in life. Before you commit, its important to know how much loan you are eligible for. Our Home Loan Eligibility Calculator Malaysia helps you check your Debt Service Ratio (DSR) instantly and estimate your maximum home loan amount, property price, and upfront costs.

This tool is designed specifically for Malaysians, with local DSR rules, margin of finance (MoF), stamp duty tiers, and legal fee estimates built in. Whether you are a first-time buyer or upgrading, youll know where you stand before approaching the bank.

What is Home Loan Eligibility?

Home loan eligibility simply means how much financing a bank is willing to approve for you. In Malaysia, the most important factor is your Debt Service Ratio (DSR).

  • DSR below 45% Most banks consider you Eligible

  • DSR between 45% 60% You are in the Borderline zone. Approval depends on bank, income, and credit record.

  • DSR above 60% Considered Not Eligible . Approval is unlikely unless you have a joint applicant or guarantor.

The calculator also checks your Margin of Finance (MoF / Loan-To-Value), which is the percentage of the property price a bank is willing to finance. Most buyers get 90% MoF, but some schemes allow 100% or even 110120% financing.

How Banks in Malaysia Assess Home Loan Eligibility

Banks do not look at just one number. Here are the key factors:

  1. Income Level Gross salary + allowances + other income (e.g., rental).

  2. Existing Commitments Car loan, credit cards, PTPTN, personal loan.

  3. DSR Calculation (Commitments + Proposed Instalment) Income 100%.

  4. Loan Tenure Longer tenure = smaller instalment, easier approval.

  5. Interest Rate Lower rate = more affordable instalment.

  6. Age of Borrower Most banks require full repayment before age 70.

  7. Credit History CCRIS / CTOS report must show good repayment habits.

  8. Property Type & Location Certain banks may impose conditions on sub-sale or under-construction properties.

Typical Bank DSR Limits in Malaysia

  • Conventional banks (Maybank, CIMB, Public Bank, Hong Leong, RHB) ~45% cap.

  • Higher income borrowers Sometimes allowed up to 60%.

  • Public sector (LPPSA financing) Monthly commitments cannot exceed 60% of gross income; total debt usually capped at 80% of net income.

Government & Special Schemes for Full Loan

Malaysia offers several schemes that let you apply for a full loan or more:

  • SJKP (Skim Jaminan Kredit Perumahan) Up to 110% financing (covers loan + MRTA + legal fees).

  • SJKP MADANI Up to 120% financing for eligible first-time buyers.

  • My First Home Scheme (RUMAWIP) Special programme for properties up to RM500k with 100% financing.

  • Stamp Duty Exemptions First-time buyers enjoy full exemption up to RM500k and 50% exemption between RM500k RM1m (subject to Budget policies).

Documents Required for Loan Application

To apply for a housing loan in Malaysia, prepare:

  • NRIC / MyKad

  • Latest 3 months payslips

  • Latest 6 months bank statements

  • Latest EPF statement / Tax return (Form B for self-employed)

  • Booking form / Sale & Purchase Agreement (SPA)

  • Business registration (if self-employed)

Banks use these to verify income, stability, and repayment ability.

Why Use Our Home Loan Eligibility Calculator?

Built with Malaysia-specific DSR rules
Supports Margin of Finance options (70%100%)
Includes developer rebate (zero downpayment) option
Auto-calculates stamp duty & legal fees
Provides Upfront Cash Needed breakdown
Visual charts for instalments vs income
Instant result: Eligible / Borderline / Not Eligible

Tips to Improve Your Loan Eligibility

  • Pay off or reduce existing loans and credit card balances

  • Apply with a joint applicant (spouse or family) to combine income

  • Extend your loan tenure (up to 35 years) if age allows

  • Improve your credit score by paying bills and loans on time

  • Keep job stability banks prefer fixed income earners

  • Save for upfront fees even if developer offers rebates

FAQ Home Loan Eligibility in Malaysia

1. What is the maximum DSR allowed by banks?
Most banks cap DSR at 45%. Some allow up to 60% if your income is high.

2. Can I get 100% home loan in Malaysia?
Yes. Some schemes (SJKP, My First Home) and certain developer projects offer full financing, either through 100% MoF or rebates covering downpayment.

3. What is the maximum loan tenure in Malaysia?
Up to 35 years or until age 70, whichever is earlier.

4. Do first-time home buyers get stamp duty exemption?
Yes. As of 2025, full exemption up to RM500k, and 50% exemption between RM500k RM1m.

5. How do I calculate my eligibility manually?
Add your monthly income, subtract commitments, apply DSR limit (usually 45%), then estimate your loan amount using bank interest & tenure. Our calculator automates this instantly.

Final Word

Your home loan eligibility depends on more than just salary. Banks look at your commitments, DSR, age, and credit history. Use this calculator to check your numbers before applying, so you can approach banks with confidence.

If youre buying with a spouse, try our [Joint Home Loan Eligibility Calculator Malaysia] for combined income scenarios.

item.content:encoded:
Joint Home Loan Eligibility Calculator Malaysia

Loading...

Malaysian Home Loan Rates & Base Rate Info [y]

  • The Standardised Base Rate (SBR) in Malaysia is 2.75% p.a., aligned with the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) as of mid-2025. CIMB Malaysia+3HSBC Malaysia+3Maybank2u+3

  • For example, HSBC HomeSmart uses SBR + 1.75%, giving an effective rate around 4.50% for a 30-year loan. HSBC Malaysia

  • CIMBs residential property financing interest rates are tiered:

    • Below RM 200,000: SBR + 2.45% ~5.20% p.a. CIMB Malaysia

    • RM 500,000: SBR + 2.05% ~4.80% p.a. CIMB Malaysia

  • Across major banks, effective home loan rates for 30-year loans typically range between 4.15% and 5.67% p.a. depending on profile, tenure, and product. Property Genie

These rates help you choose a realistic benchmark to plug into your calculator.

What Is DSR & Why Its Critical

DSR (Debt Service Ratio) is how banks measure the share of your income going toward debt. Its calculated as:

(Existing monthly debt payments + new home loan instalment) Gross (or net) monthly income 100%

  • In Malaysia, many banks accept DSR up to 6070% for first-time homebuyers. iProperty+2iMoney+2

  • But a DSR at the upper limit is risky. A safer target is 60% or lower to strengthen your application. iMoney+1

  • Some banks may allow DSR above 70% in exceptional cases or for high-income customers, but thats rarely the norm. Sharlife+3PropertyGuru Malaysia+3IQI Global+3

  • Note: Banks differ in whether they use gross income or net income (after EPF, SOCSO). And they may exclude certain income sources or debt obligations. Direct Lending+2iProperty+2

Because of this variation, your calculator should treat DSR as indicative, not guaranteed.

How to Use the Calculator Wisely

  1. Enter both applicants gross monthly incomes

  2. Add all monthly debt payments (car loan, personal loan, credit cards, PTPTN)

  3. Input ages the older applicant will limit the maximum loan tenure (often capped by age 70)

  4. Select a realistic interest rate (e.g. 4.55.5%)

  5. Choose a loan tenure (20, 25, 30, 35 years)

  6. The calculator outputs:

    • Combined income & commitments

    • Maximum monthly instalment you can afford

    • Eligible loan amount (reverse-PMT)

    • Your DSR percentage, with status (green/orange/red)

Use the outputs to test different scenarios (lower DSR cap, shorter tenure) until it looks safe.

Who Can Apply for a Joint Home Loan in Malaysia?

Many people think joint home loans are limited to married couples but thats not true. In Malaysia, banks generally allow joint applications with:

  • Spouse or fianc/fiance the most common arrangement, combining household incomes.

  • Parents and children useful when younger buyers have limited income but parents want to help.

  • Siblings or relatives brothers, sisters, or close family members who want to invest in property together.

  • Business partners or friends some banks may accept non-family joint borrowers, provided both meet credit and legal requirements.

However, banks will require all joint applicants to be co-borrowers on the loan and co-owners of the property title (depending on tenure type). This means every applicant shares equal responsibility for repayments. If one party defaults, the other(s) are still legally liable.

Key Considerations Before Applying Jointly

  • Ownership Split: Check how the property will be registered (e.g. equal shares, tenancy-in-common).

  • Legal Obligations: All co-borrowers are jointly and severally liable for the entire loan amount.

  • Exit Plan: Consider what happens if one person wants to sell their share refinancing or transfer may be needed.

  • Credit Check: Each applicants CCRIS/CTOS record is assessed; a weak score from one person may reduce approval chances.

Why a Joint Loan Can Be Beneficial

  • Boosts total eligible loan amount.

  • Helps younger buyers enter the property market sooner.

  • Shares the financial burden between two or more parties.

  • Strengthens approval chances if both incomes are stable and commitments are manageable.

But remember: while joint loans increase affordability, they also bind you legally with your co-borrower. Always plan carefully, especially if applying with siblings, friends, or business partners.

Tips to Improve Your Eligibility

  • Trim existing debts repay credit cards, reduce personal loans.

  • Aim for DSR below 60% to stay in safer zones.

  • Make a larger down payment borrow less, reduce instalment.

  • Ensure stable employment history banks favour consistent income.

  • Clean credit record CCRIS / CTOS matters.

item.title: Early Housing Loan Settlement Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Early Housing Loan Settlement Calculator Malaysia

Loading...

Housing Loan Settlement Calculator Malaysia Save Money by Paying Off Early

Are you considering settling your home loan early in Malaysia? Many homeowners dream of becoming debt-free sooner, but the process can feel confusing. Questions like How is early settlement calculated?, What penalty will I pay?, and Will I really save on interest? often come up.

This is where a Housing Loan Settlement Calculator Malaysia becomes extremely useful. It allows you to estimate the outstanding balance, potential savings on interest, and whether it is worth making a lump sum or full settlement on your mortgage.

In this guide, well explain how early housing loan settlement works in Malaysia, the common penalties, and how you can use a settlement calculator to plan smarter.

What Is Housing Loan Settlement?

A housing loan settlement refers to the process of paying off your home loan in full before the agreed tenure ends. For example, if you took a 35-year mortgage but want to clear it in 15 years, you are making an early settlement.

Early settlement can happen in two ways:

  1. Full Settlement Paying off the entire outstanding balance plus any settlement fees.

  2. Partial Settlement Making a lump sum payment that reduces your principal, helping you save on interest and shorten your tenure.

Why Use a Housing Loan Settlement Calculator in Malaysia?

A settlement calculator helps you:

  • Know the outstanding balance How much you need to pay today to fully settle the loan.

  • Estimate interest savings See how much interest you can avoid by paying earlier.

  • Compare scenarios Try different amounts (RM20,000 lump sum vs RM100,000 lump sum) to see the impact on loan tenure.

  • Plan your finances Decide whether using your savings for loan settlement is worth it compared to investing elsewhere.

Instead of manually calculating complex amortization schedules, the calculator gives you an instant estimate.

How Is Early Settlement Calculated in Malaysia?

Every bank in Malaysia uses an amortization schedule to determine how much of your monthly installment goes to interest and principal. In the early years, most of your payment goes towards interest. As time passes, more goes towards principal.

When you request an early settlement, the bank will:

  1. Calculate your outstanding principal.

  2. Add any accrued interest up to the settlement date.

  3. Include early settlement penalty (if any, usually 25% of the outstanding balance if within the lock-in period).

Formula (simplified):
Outstanding Balance + Accrued Interest + Penalty Fees = Settlement Amount

Early Settlement Penalties in Malaysia

Many housing loans in Malaysia come with a lock-in period, typically the first 35 years of the loan. If you fully settle during this period, the bank may impose a penalty fee.

  • Lock-in period: Usually 35 years

  • Penalty fee: 25% of outstanding loan amount

For example, if your outstanding loan is RM300,000 and your penalty is 3%, you would pay RM9,000 as a settlement penalty.

Tip: Always check your Letter of Offer or ask your bank about early settlement clauses.

Benefits of Settling a Housing Loan Early

  1. Save on Interest The biggest advantage is reducing total interest paid. For long-term loans, this can mean tens of thousands in savings.

  2. Become Debt-Free Enjoy peace of mind knowing your property is fully yours.

  3. Increase Cash Flow Once monthly installments stop, you can redirect money to investments, retirement, or other goals.

  4. Better Credit Profile A fully paid loan improves your financial standing if you plan to apply for future credit.

Disadvantages of Settling Early

While paying off your loan early sounds ideal, its not always the best financial move.

  • Penalty Costs If still under the lock-in period, settlement penalties may cancel out your savings.

  • Lost Investment Opportunities Money used to settle could potentially earn higher returns if invested elsewhere.

  • Liquidity Issues Using all your cash to settle may leave you with less emergency savings.

This is why using a Housing Loan Settlement Calculator Malaysia is crucial it helps you compare whether settlement makes financial sense for you.

Example: Settlement Savings

Imagine you have a RM500,000 loan over 30 years at 4% interest. After 10 years, you still owe about RM400,000.

  • If you settle today: You avoid paying the remaining 20 years of interest, potentially saving over RM180,000.

  • If you wait and pay normally: You will continue paying monthly installments, and a large portion will go towards interest.

By testing different scenarios in the calculator, you can make an informed choice.

FAQs About Housing Loan Settlement in Malaysia

1. Can I settle my home loan early?
Yes, most Malaysian banks allow it. Check your lock-in period first.

2. Do I pay full interest if I settle early?
No, you only pay the outstanding balance, accrued interest until settlement, and penalties (if any).

3. How do I calculate the settlement amount?
Use a settlement calculator or request a settlement statement from your bank.

4. Is it better to settle or invest the money?
It depends on your financial goals. If your investments can earn higher returns than your loan interest rate, investing may be better.

Final Thoughts

Settling your housing loan early in Malaysia can be a smart financial move if done at the right time. By using a Housing Loan Settlement Calculator Malaysia, you can estimate your settlement amount, compare savings, and decide whether to proceed.

Remember to always check your loan agreement for lock-in periods and penalties before making the decision. For many homeowners, the peace of mind of being debt-free is priceless.

item.title: Personal Loan Calculator Malaysia Based On Salary
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Personal Loan Calculator Malaysia Eligibility Based on Salary

Loading...

Personal Loan Eligibility Criteria in Malaysia

When applying for a personal loan, banks dont just look at numbers. They also check your overall profile to decide if you qualify. Here are the most common eligibility factors used by Malaysian lenders:

1. Minimum Salary Requirement

  • Entry point is usually RM2,000 RM3,000 gross income per month.

  • Higher income improves approval rate and increases loan size options.

2. Employment Type & Duration

  • Permanent full-time staff are preferred.

  • Contract staff, freelancers, or commission earners may face stricter rules.

  • Some banks require at least 6 months in your current job or 2 years in total employment.

3. Age Range

  • Most banks set 21 60 years as the standard.

  • Some extend to 65 years provided the loan is cleared before retirement.

4. Credit Standing

  • CCRIS / CTOS reports are always checked.

  • Any missed payments, overdue loans, or blacklisting will reduce eligibility.

  • A clean repayment history strengthens your chances and may unlock lower interest.

5. Debt Commitments (DSR)

  • Even if you meet income and age, your Debt Service Ratio must stay within the ~60% guideline.

  • Example: A RM4,000 salary means max RM2,400 can go to all loans combined.

6. Other Factors

  • Nationality: Most banks only approve Malaysian citizens or PR holders.

  • Loan Tenure & Amount: Shorter tenure may increase approval chances since monthly instalments are more manageable.

  • Banking Relationship: Existing salary crediting or savings account with the same bank may help approval.


Personal Loan Calculator Based on Salary In Malaysia

Not sure how much you can actually borrow? Use the calculator with your monthly income to estimate eligibility based on Malaysias common 60% DSR (Debt Service Ratio) rule.

  • Step 1: Enter your monthly income (e.g., RM5,000).

  • Step 2: Calculator applies a 60% DSR cap RM3,000 is the maximum allowed for all debts combined.

  • Step 3: If you already have car loan, housing loan, or credit card commitments, deduct those first.

  • Step 4: The remaining amount shows the maximum monthly instalment you can afford.

  • Step 5: Calculator will estimate the maximum loan amount you qualify for, based on chosen interest rate and tenure.

Example (for illustration only):

  • Income: RM4,000/month

  • 60% DSR = RM2,400 cap

  • Existing commitments: RM1,200 (car + credit card)

  • Balance available for new loan: RM1,200

  • At 7% interest, 5-year tenure eligible loan amount RM50,000

This helps you avoid rejection and know your real budget before applying.

Looking to borrow money for a big purchase, emergency, debt consolidation or personal project? Use our Personal Loan Calculator Malaysia to estimate your monthly instalment, total interest, and affordability fast, easy, and free.

This tool supports both flat rate and effective (reducing balance) calculations giving you more transparency than basic bank calculators.

Why Use This Calculator?

  • Compare total cost between flat vs reducing interest methods

  • Adjust for tenure, interest rate, and principal to see impact

  • Estimate eligibility based on your income and DSR (Debt Service Ratio)

  • Preview repayment schedule: principal, interest, and balance breakdown

  • Use real-time data (Malaysia bank rates) to guide your inputs

Typical Interest Rates in Malaysia

Here are reference rates youll find today (for illustration):

  • CIMB Cash Plus: fixed rates from 4.38% p.a., equivalent effective rates may reach ~8%+ depending on tenure. CIMB Malaysia

  • Alliance Bank Personal Financing: from 4.99% flat p.a., up to ~16.68% flat for longer terms. Alliance Bank

  • Maybank Personal Loan: fixed profit rates ~6.5% 8.0% depending on loan amount and tenure. Maybank2u

  • HSBC Amanah (Islamic): provides personal financing with a built-in profit rate model. HSBC Amanah

  • Muamalat Personal Financing-i: up to RM400,000 and tenures up to 10 years with profit rates starting low. Bank Muamalat Malaysia

Tip: Use current market rate ranges above to pick your input rate. Entering something wildly different can mislead your decision.

How This Calculator Works

FeatureDescription
Flat Rate OptionInterest calculated simply: principal rate years. Total cost spread evenly over term.
Effective / Reducing OptionStandard loan amortization. Interest is charged on the remaining balance monthly.
Fees & ProcessingOptional fields to include processing fees or other chargesthese increase the real APR/EIR.
Eligibility (DSR-based)If you input your income, the calculator estimates whether the monthly instalment fits within your DSR cap (default 60%).
Repayment ScheduleOptional breakdown by month: principal, interest, remaining balanceto help you understand the cost over time.

What to Look Out For

  • Term vs Interest Trade-off: Longer loan term lower monthly payments but much higher total interest paid.

  • Flat vs Effective: Flat looks simple but often undervalues how much real cost you pay in early years.

  • Fees & Hidden Charges: Some loans have stamp duty, processing fees, or early settlement penalties. Always read the PDS (Product Disclosure Sheet).

  • DSR / Affordability: Even if the loan looks ok, exceeding DSR limits might cause disapproval.

  • Credit Score Impact: Cheaper rates often go to those with better credit history or stable income.

  • Early Settlement: Check if the loan allows you to pay off earlier, and whether it charges penalty.

How to Use This Page Effectively

  1. Enter the loan amount, interest rate, tenure (in years).

  2. Optionally input your monthly income and check eligibility.

  3. Choose between flat rate or effective reducing rate.

  4. (Optional) Add fees to get a more realistic cost.

  5. Once your inputs are in, view results:

    • Monthly payment

    • Total interest

    • Total repayment

    • Eligibility verdict

    • Expand the repayment schedule to see breakdown month by month

  6. Use this output to determine whether to apply, negotiate, or compare other loan offers.

FAQ Frequently Asked Questions

Q1. Whats the difference: flat rate vs effective interest?

  • Flat rate = interest computed on full loan amount for full term; simple and linear.

  • Effective / reducing balance = you pay interest monthly on outstanding balance; more realistic and fairer.

Q2. Why do interest rates vary across banks?

  • Differences in risk, operating cost, capital structure, and borrower profile all affect rates.

  • Some loans are Islamic (profit rate) vs conventional.

  • Market interest (via Bank Negaras OPR) influences base cost.

Q3. What is DSR and why is it important?

  • DSR = Debt Service Ratio. Lenders often limit all debt payments (including new loan) to ~5060% of income.

  • If your monthly instalment exceeds that, you may get rejected despite being approved by the calculator.

Q4. Can I settle a personal loan early?

  • Yes, but check if theres a penalty (some banks waive it), or if 3 months notice is required.

Q5. Do I need collateral or guarantor?

  • Most personal loans in Malaysia are unsecured (no collateral). Some require guarantors if borrower risk is high.

Q6. Is this tool legally binding?

  • No. This is an estimate only. Actual loan approval and cost depend on credit checks, bank policy, and final offer. Always request the PDS.

item.title: Credit Card Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Credit Card Calculator Malaysia [y]

Loading...

Credit Card Calculator Malaysia

Managing credit card debt is a challenge for many Malaysians. High interest rates, compounding charges, and only making minimum payments can stretch repayment into years. This is where a Credit Card Calculator Malaysia becomes useful. With it, you can see exactly how long repayment will take, how much interest youll pay, and how extra payments can save you time and money.

Minimum Payment Rules in Malaysia

By regulation, Malaysian banks require you to pay at least 5% of the outstanding balance or RM50, whichever is higher.

While this keeps your account current, it doesnt reduce your debt quickly. If you only make the minimum payment, the calculator will show that repayment may stretch into many years with very high interest costs.

For example, a RM5,000 balance at 18% interest with just minimum payments could take over 7 years to clear and cost thousands in interest.

Why Our Calculator Is Better Than Bank Tools

Most bank calculators, like those on Maybank, CIMB, and RHB websites, only show the minimum payment repayment estimate. Our calculator lets you:

  • Enter custom payment amounts

  • Compare savings vs minimum payment

  • Use quick presets for balance, interest rate, and monthly payments

  • Get a visual pie chart for easy understanding

This makes it far more versatile and educational.

Tips to Reduce Credit Card Debt Faster

  • Always pay more than the minimum even small increases help.

  • Use promotional balance transfer plans but check fees and duration.

  • Avoid adding new purchases while repaying.

  • Stay in the lowest interest tier by always paying on time.

  • Build an emergency fund so you dont rely on your credit card for unexpected expenses.

Final Thoughts

Whether youre searching for a credit card interest calculator Malaysia to understand finance charges, or a credit card repayment calculator Malaysia to plan faster payoff, this tool gives you both in one place.

By testing different scenarios, youll clearly see how higher payments shorten your repayment period and reduce total interest costs. Use it today to take control of your credit card debt and make smarter financial decisions.

item.title: Credit Card Interest Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Credit Card Interest Calculator Malaysia [y]

Loading...

Credit Card Interest Calculator Malaysia

When you carry a balance on your credit card, banks charge interest that compounds daily. This makes it harder to clear debt if you only pay the minimum. Our Credit Card Interest Calculator Malaysia helps you estimate how much interest youll pay and how different rates affect your repayment.

How Credit Card Interest Works in Malaysia

In Malaysia, credit card interest rates are tiered:

  • 15% p.a. if you pay on time for 12 months

  • 17% p.a. if you missed 12 payments

  • 18% p.a. if you missed more than 2 payments

Interest is calculated daily and added to your outstanding balance. If you do not pay the full amount, new purchases also start accruing interest from the transaction date.

This means even small balances can grow quickly. For example: RM5,000 at 18% can accumulate nearly RM1,000 in interest if repaid slowly.

Using the Calculator

  1. Enter your credit card balance (RM).

  2. Choose the interest rate presets for 15%, 18%, or custom.

  3. Select your monthly payment amount.

  4. Click Calculate.

Youll see:

  • Total interest charged

  • Total repayment amount

  • Months to repay

Why This Matters

Many Malaysians underestimate how much interest costs. Even though the monthly minimum seems small, the long-term interest is huge. By experimenting with higher payments in the calculator, youll clearly see how to save both money and time.

Tips to Reduce Interest

  • Pay your full statement balance to enjoy interest-free days.

  • Always pay on time to keep the lowest rate tier (15%).

  • Avoid cash advances these attract higher interest with no grace period.

  • If you cant pay in full, increase your repayment amount as much as possible.

Final Word

If youre searching for a credit card interest calculator Malaysia, this tool shows exactly how much youre paying in finance charges and how to minimize them. Use it today to compare scenarios and take control of your debt.

item.title: Credit Card Minimum Payment Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Credit Card Minimum Payment Calculator Malaysia

Loading...

Credit Card Minimum Payment Calculator Malaysia

The minimum payment is the lowest amount you must pay each month to keep your account current. In Malaysia, this is 5% of your balance or RM50, whichever is higher. While this avoids late fees, it can trap you in long-term debt because interest keeps piling up.

Our Credit Card Minimum Payment Calculator Malaysia shows you how long it takes to pay off your balance if you only make minimum payments and why paying more is a smarter choice.

How Minimum Payments Work

If your balance is RM2,000, the minimum is 5% = RM100. Pay only that, and the remaining RM1,900 continues to accrue interest. Next month, interest is added on top, and the cycle repeats.

For larger balances, this means repayment can stretch into years, with total interest exceeding the original borrowed amount.

Using the Calculator

  1. Enter your outstanding balance (RM).

  2. Choose your interest rate (e.g. 18%).

  3. Select Minimum Payment preset.

  4. Click Calculate.

Youll see how many months it will take to repay, how much total interest is charged, and how much youll end up paying overall.

Example Scenario

  • Balance: RM5,000

  • Interest: 18% p.a.

  • Minimum Payment: RM250 (5%)

Result: It may take 7+ years to clear, and interest could exceed RM3,000.

If instead you pay RM500 per month, repayment drops to under 1 year, with less than RM400 in interest.

Why Paying Only Minimum Is Risky

  • Debt lasts much longer.

  • Interest costs multiply.

  • You remain stuck in the high interest tier.

  • Financial stress increases because balance hardly goes down.

How to Escape the Minimum Trap

  • Always pay more than the minimum even an extra RM100 helps.

  • Consider a balance transfer with 0% interest.

  • Use personal loans with lower rates to consolidate high-interest debt.

  • Avoid new spending on the card until the balance is cleared.

Final Word

If you searched for a credit card minimum payment calculator Malaysia, this tool shows how costly paying only the minimum can be. Test different repayment amounts and commit to paying more to save thousands in interest.

item.title: Car Loan Calculator Malaysia
item.dc:creator: jayooi5115@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Car Loan Calculator Malaysia [y]

Loading...

Use our free Car Loan Calculator Malaysia to estimate your monthly instalments, total interest, and repayment schedule. Whether you are buying a Proton, Perodua, or imported car, this tool helps you make smarter financial decisions before committing to a loan.

Why Use a Car Loan Calculator?

  • Instantly estimate your monthly repayment

  • Compare different loan periods, interest rates, and down payments

  • See the breakdown of principal vs interest over time

  • Avoid surprises by knowing your total repayment in advance

Car Loan Basics in Malaysia

  • Maximum tenure: Up to 9 years (108 months) under hire purchase law

  • Down payment: Usually 10% for new cars, up to 20% or more for used/recond cars

  • Margin of finance: Banks typically finance up to 90% of car price

  • Early settlement: May include a rebate or penalty, depending on bank terms

Current Car Loan Interest Rates [y]

Typical bank financing rates: ~2.8% 4.0% per annum

  • RHB Auto Financing-i: From ~2.10% p.a. (promotional campaigns for EV/hybrid)

  • Bank Islam Vehicle Financing-i: ~2.5% 3.3% p.a. depending on car type

  • Maybank / CIMB / Public Bank: Average ~3.0% 3.5% p.a. for new passenger cars

  • Commercial / used cars: Rates may go above 4.0%

Tip: Always check the latest promotions, as banks run seasonal campaigns.

How Instalments Are Calculated

Formula used by banks:

Monthly Payment=LoanAmountmonthlyRate1(1+monthlyRate)ntext{Monthly Payment} = frac{LoanAmount times monthlyRate}{1 - (1 + monthlyRate)^{-n}}Monthly Payment=1(1+monthlyRate)nLoanAmountmonthlyRate

Where:

  • Loan Amount = Car Price Down Payment

  • monthlyRate = Annual Rate 12

  • n = Loan Tenure (months)

Example:

  • Car price: RM 90,000

  • Down payment: 10% (RM 9,000)

  • Loan tenure: 7 years

  • Interest rate: 3.5%

Monthly repayment RM 1,020

Example Scenarios

Scenario Car Price Down Payment Tenure Rate Monthly Total Interest
A RM 90,000 10% 7 yrs 3.5% ~RM 1,020 Medium
B RM 90,000 20% 5 yrs 3.24% Higher monthly, less total interest Low
C RM 90,000 10% 9 yrs 3.75% Lower monthly, but total repayment much higher High

  • Shorter tenure = higher monthly, lower cost overall

  • Longer tenure = lower monthly, but pay more in interest

Factors Affecting Car Loan Rates

  • Credit score (CTOS / CCRIS) strong history = better rates

  • Tenure longer loans often cost more

  • Car type & age new/national cars usually cheaper to finance

  • Bank promotions special campaign rates may be available

Eligibility & Documents Needed

  • Age 2160 years (varies by bank)

  • Malaysian IC / passport + valid drivers license

  • Latest 3 months payslips or salary statements

  • Bank statements (36 months)

  • For self-employed: business registration + income proof

Tips to Save on Car Loans

  • Pay a higher down payment if possible lower principal & interest

  • Choose a shorter tenure if your budget allows

  • Compare multiple banks before signing with a dealer

  • Keep a clean credit record to qualify for better promos

  • Watch out for early settlement fees or lock-in periods

Why Our Car Loan Calculator Helps

  • Clear breakdown of monthly instalment, total interest, and total repayment

  • Compare different scenarios in seconds

  • More flexible than single-bank calculators (works with any rate or tenure)

  • Helps you plan ahead before talking to a dealer or bank officer
